result.execSummary:
The defendant June Devon Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs due by continued payment plan of $75 per month. All payments to be applied toward attorney fees first before fine/costs.
Submit to DNA and pay $200 surcharge

records.addlTxt: for payment of attorney fees - forwarded to branch
for Payment of Attorney Fees

Defendant June Devon Jenkins in court with attorney Gary R Schmaus.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Concurrent recommendation given. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence. Defendant to submit to DNA sample. Attorney fee amount to be submitted with amended JOC to follow. Fine/costs due by continued payment plan of $75 per month. All payments to be applied toward attorney fees first before fine/costs.
Plea hearing at 08-05-2015 08:15 am

Defendant June Devon Jenkins in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates countacted five attorneys, unable to retain any due to each attorney wanting $2000+ in retainer fees.  Court will appoint Atty Schmaus (in court today), defendant paying $70/mo commencing 7/24 and continue on the 24th of each month thereafter until case disposed.  Atty Schmaus requesting adj.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing at 07-08-2015 08:15 am

Defendant June Devon Jenkins in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant files petition for appointment of counsel.  Defendant advises does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court directs defendant to contact three separate attorneys to determine if can retain counsel before the Court would consider appointing counsel.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Adjourned plea hearing at 06-15-2015 10:00 am
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant June Devon Jenkins in court, in custody from Ozaukee Co Jail. Atty Nadya Perez-Reyes appears with defendant as a friend of the court and will evaluate him for representation.   Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not receive complaint and that is why he missed his court hearing.  Court advises of penalties. State is requesting $500 signature bond.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant

Defendant June Devon Jenkins not in court for initial appearance, defendant in custody.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause and based on non-appearance will issue warrant and forfeit bail.
Initial appearance on February 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
